alert.note: Alert for Codington; Deuel; Hamlin (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued March 31 at 1:53AM MDT until April 01 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...ICE STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Ice Storm Warning, significant icing. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of one quarter to three tenths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Codington, Hamlin and Deuel Counties. * WHEN...For the Ice Storm Warning, until 4 PM CDT this afternoon. For the Blizzard Warning, from 4 PM this afternoon to 7 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
